nl.strohalm.cyclos.services.permissions
Interface PermissionService

All Superinterfaces:
Service
All Known Subinterfaces:
PermissionServiceLocal
All Known Implementing Classes:
PermissionServiceImpl, PermissionServiceSecurity
public interface PermissionService
extends Service

Service interface for group permissions This service use to control permissions and to list the permissions by group.

Author:
rafael, luis

getAllVisibleGroups

java.util.Collection<Group> getAllVisibleGroups()
Returns all the visible groups for the logged user. For members / brokers / operators, it's the same as getVisibleMemberGroups(). For admins, those who have the permission to manage other admins or to view admin groups, will also include all admin groups.

getManagedMemberGroups

java.util.Collection<MemberGroup> getManagedMemberGroups()
Returns the managed member groups for the logged user. It works like this:
  • For administrators, the result is AdminGroup.getManagesGroups()
  • For members, the result is only his own group
  • For brokers, as brokers could potentially manage members in any visible groups (its a per-user relationship), all visible groups are returned
  • For operators, it's only his owner's group
  • For system, all member groups

getPermissionCatalogHandler

PermissionCatalogHandler getPermissionCatalogHandler(Group group)
This method must be used only for group permission's edition

Parameters:
group - the group to which edit the permissions
Returns:
a handler for all multivalued group's permissions

getVisibleMemberGroups

java.util.Collection<MemberGroup> getVisibleMemberGroups()
Returns the visible member groups for the logged user. It works like this:
  • For administrators, the result is AdminGroup.getManagesGroups()
  • For members / brokers, the result is MemberGroup.getCanViewProfileOfGroups()
  • For operators, is his owner group's MemberGroup.getCanViewProfileOfGroups()
  • For system, all member groups

hasPermission

boolean hasPermission(Module module)
Checks if the group of the logged member has at least one of the module's permissions. Preferentially, use the permission() method

Returns:
The boolean result for permission check

hasPermission

boolean hasPermission(Permission... permission)
Checks if the group of the logged member has at least one of the specified permissions. Preferentially, use the permission() method

Returns:
The boolean result for permission check

hasPermissionFor

boolean hasPermissionFor(Permission permission,
                         Entity... required)
Parameters:
permission - a multivalued permission having a relationship from which get its allowed values
Returns:
true if the logged member has permission for all required entities

manages

boolean manages(Element element)
Returns whether the logged user can manage the given element. Manage means one of the following:
  • The current invocation is a system task LoggedUser.isSystem()
  • The logged user is the same as the given element
  • The logged user is the broker of the given element
  • The logged user is the member and the element is one of its operators
  • Both logged user and the given element are administrators, and logged user has permissions over other administrators
  • The logged user is administrator with permission to manage the given element's group, being the given element a member
  • if the logged user is an operator, and the element is the member to which it belongs

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the element parameter is null. However, the method passes with a null element parameter if (and only if) LoggedUser.isSystem().

manages

boolean manages(Group group)
Returns whether the logged user can manage the given group. If the group is an admin group, the logged user must be an admin with either AdminAdminPermission.ADMINS_REGISTER or AdminAdminPermission.ADMINS_CHANGE_PROFILE permissions. If the group is a member group, checks whether it is returned by getManagedMemberGroups(). Finally, for operator groups, only their owner can manage them.

permission

PermissionCheck permission()
Returns a PermissionCheck, which can be used to enforce the logged user's permissions which are not related to an specific user.

permission

PermissionCheck permission(Element element)
Returns a PermissionCheck, which will, besides of checking static permissions, ensure that the logged user is allowed to manage the given Element, according to manages(Element)

relatesTo

boolean relatesTo(Element element)
Returns true if the logged user is related to the given element. Related to means one of the following:
  • The logged user manages the given element, according to manages(Element)
  • The logged user is a member with permission to view the profile of the given member, according to MemberGroup.getCanViewProfileOfGroups()
  • Both the logged user and the given element are operators of the same member
